Class Tile

java.lang.Object
model.Tile
Direct Known Subclasses:
BarrierTile, DestructibleTile, IndestructibleTile, WalkableTile
public abstract class Tile extends Object
The Tile class is the abstract base class for all terrain types on the Bomberman-style game board.

Each tile tracks its board position (row, column) and defines how it behaves regarding:

  • Walkability — whether the hero and drones may step on this tile.
  • Destructibility — whether bombs can destroy or modify this tile.
  • Tile type — represented as a character used for rendering logic.

Subclasses such as WalkableTile, DestructibleTile, IndestructibleTile, and BarrierTile provide specific implementations for these behaviors.

  • Field Details

    • row

      protected int row
      The row index of the tile on the game board grid.

    • col

      protected int col
      The column index of the tile on the game board grid.

  • Constructor Details

    • Tile

      public Tile(int row, int col)
      Constructs a tile located at the specified grid position.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index where this tile exists
      col - the column index where this tile exists

  • Method Details

    • isWalkable

      public abstract boolean isWalkable()
      Returns whether entities (hero, drones, bombs, etc.) can walk onto this tile.
      Returns:
      true if movement is allowed, false if blocked

    • setWalkable

      public abstract void setWalkable(boolean walkability)
      Updates the walkability status of this tile.

      This is commonly used when a bomb occupies a tile. During bomb placement, many Bomberman-style mechanics temporarily make the tile non-walkable so the hero cannot step back onto it until the explosion resolves.

      Parameters:
      walkability - true to allow movement; false to block movement

    • getType

      public abstract char getType()
      Returns the character identifying this tile type (e.g., ' ', 'D', 'I', 'B', etc.). This character is used by the rendering system to determine which sprite to draw.
      Returns:
      a character representing the tile type

    • getRow

      public int getRow()
      Returns the row index where this tile is located.
      Returns:
      the row index of the tile

    • getCol

      public int getCol()
      Returns the column index where this tile is located.
      Returns:
      the column index of the tile

    • setBarrierType

      public void setBarrierType(char type)
      Optional hook used by BarrierTile subclasses to assign specific barrier types such as corners, edges, or special shapes.

      Default implementation does nothing; subclasses override as needed.

      Parameters:
      type - the barrier type character to assign

    • setDestroyed

      public void setDestroyed()
      Optional hook used mainly by destructible tiles when being destroyed by an explosion.

      Default implementation does nothing and is overridden by classes like DestructibleTile.

    • getDestroyedStatus

      public boolean getDestroyedStatus()
      Returns whether this tile has been destroyed.

      Only destructible tiles override this behavior. All other tiles return true by default as a neutral/no-op behavior.

      Returns:
      true if destroyed, otherwise false
